text.0: prayers have been offered up through love of glory vasiṣṭha honour indra in the battle.
text.1: he who with might extends through all existence hears words which i his faithful servant utter.
text.2: a cry was raised which reached the gods o indra a cry to them to send us strength in combat.
text.3: none among men knows his own lifes duration bear us in safety over these our troubles.
text.4: the bays the bootyseeking car i harness my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly.
text.5: indra when he had slain resistless foemen forced with his might the two worldhalves asunder.
text.6: like barren cows moreover swelled the waters the singen sought thy holy rite o indra.
text.7: come unto us as with his team comes vāyu thou through our solemn hymns bestowest booty.
text.8: so may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee indra the mighty very bounteous to the singer.
text.9: alone among the gods thou pitiest mortals o hero make thee glad at this libation.
text.10: thus the vasisthas glorify with praises indra the powerful whose arm wields thunder.
text.11: praised may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
